title: Valentine single-page prompt with evasive No button and Yes meme reveal (frontend-only)

requirements.summary: Implement a single-page Valentine prompt UI with the question and prominent Yes/No options.
acceptanceCriteria: The page shows a clear main question: "Will you be my Valentine?"
All user-facing text is in English

file_operations.description: Implement the single-page Valentine prompt view in the app root, rendering the question text and two prominent actions (Yes/No). Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Card) for consistent UI composition; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Confirm document title and base HTML are aligned with the single-purpose Valentine experience (no additional pages/routes introduced).

requirements.summary: Make the No button evade interaction on desktop hover and on iPad/touch press so it cannot be clicked, while staying fully visible in its container.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, when the cursor approaches/enters the "No" button area, the button relocates to a new position within the visible container
On iPad/touch, attempting to tap/press the "No" button causes it to move before a click/tap can be registered
The "No" button always remains fully visible within the main content area (does not move off-screen)
It is not possible to successfully click/tap the "No" button in normal use

file_operations.description: Create a hook that computes safe randomized positions for the No button within a measured container (accounting for button size/padding) and exposes handlers for pointer/mouse/touch interactions to relocate it before click can register.

Wire the evasive No behavior: wrap buttons in a bounded container, measure container/button dimensions, position the No button absolutely/relatively within bounds, and attach hover/pointerdown/touchstart handlers so it moves away pre-click (desktop + iPad).

requirements.summary: On Yes, transition to a celebratory success view showing the generated 'Good choice' meme image and de-emphasize/replace the prompt.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking/tapping "Yes" transitions to a success state
The success state prominently displays the generated meme image with readable text "Good choice"
The original "Yes"/"No" prompt is no longer the primary focus after clicking "Yes" (e.g., hidden or replaced)

file_operations.description: Add a Yes-driven success state that replaces the prompt UI with a celebratory view and renders the static meme image. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card/Button) to keep layout consistent; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive romantic pink/white visual theme with simple, focused typography and decorative styling across both prompt and success views.
acceptanceCriteria: The primary palette is pink and white, with appropriate contrast for readability
Layout remains intentionally simple with one clear call-to-action
Styling is consistent across the prompt and the "Yes" success view

file_operations.description: Define/adjust global theme tokens and base styles to enforce a romantic pink/white palette and readable typography (without editing any files under frontend/src/components/ui).

Apply cohesive Tailwind-based layout/styling for both prompt and success states (simple centered layout, romantic accents), composing shadcn-ui components as needed; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add the required generated meme image as a static frontend asset and render it directly from the frontend static path.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated image files exist under frontend/public/assets/generated
The success view loads the meme image via a static path from the frontend
No backend endpoints are used for image delivery

file_operations.description: Add the required generated asset file to the repository at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/good-choice-meme.dim_800x800.png.
Reference and render the static image frontend/public/assets/generated/good-choice-meme.dim_800x800.png in the success view via a frontend static asset path (no backend involvement).

requirements.summary: Ensure iPad Chrome compatibility with responsive layout, large tap targets, and touch-safe interaction logic (not hover-only).
acceptanceCriteria: Buttons are sized for touch (comfortable tap targets) and remain usable on tablet-sized screens
The "No" evasion behavior works on touch interaction (not just hover)
No horizontal scrolling is required on iPad-sized viewports

file_operations.description: Ensure responsive, iPad-friendly layout (no horizontal overflow) and large tap targets for both buttons; ensure No uses pointer/touch handlers in addition to hover for iPad Chrome.
Add/adjust global overflow and base responsive rules as needed to avoid horizontal scrolling on tablet viewports while preserving the romantic theme.
